availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Carter Westerfield Biggers (Monroe County, KY, farm laborer and militia colonel)

body.p: Monroe County, Kentucky, soldier. Monroe County native. Son of George W. Biggers and Nancy Sabens. Married to Elizabeth Payne. Father of Millard F. Biggers. Farm laborer in Monroe County in 1860. Served in 79th Regiment Kentucky Enrolled Militia as colonel in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, p. 423B.

Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, Sartain, p. 184A.
_ Kentucky, Death Records, 1852-1964 _Microfilm # 7016150, Barren County, January 20, 1913.
Kentucky, County Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Metcalfe County, October 19, 1892, p. 261 (Accessed via Ancestry).
KYR-0002-044-0017.
